passages.17:13: I myself will be a father to him, and he himself will be a son to me. And I will not remove my steadfast love from him as I took it away from whoever was before you.
passages.17:14: And I will establish him in my house and in my kingdom forever, and his throne will be established forever." '"
passages.17:15: According to all these words and according to all this revelation, thus did Nathan speak to David.
passages.17:16: Then King David went and sat before Yahweh and said, "Who [am] I, O Yahweh God, and what [is] my house that you have brought me thus far?
passages.17:17: And this was a small [matter] in your eyes, O God. And you have spoken concerning the house of your servant for a long [time] and have shown me {future generations to come},<note: Literally "with a turn of humankind ascending"> O Yahweh God.
passages.17:18: {What more}<note: Literally "What to add again"> can David [do] to you for honoring your servant? Now you know your servant.
passages.17:19: O Yahweh, for the sake of your servant and according to your heart you have done all this greatness, to make known all [these] great things.
passages.17:20: O Yahweh, there is none like you, and there is no God except you, according to all that we have heard with our ears.
passages.17:21: And who [is] like your people Israel, [the] one nation upon earth whom God went to redeem for himself, to establish for you a reputation<note: Or "name"> for great and awesome things, to drive out nations from before your people whom you redeemed from Egypt?
passages.17:22: And you made your people Israel an everlasting nation for yourself. And you, O Yahweh, became their God.
passages.17:23: So now, O Yahweh, let the word that you spoke to your servant and to his house be established forever, that you might do what you have spoken.
passages.17:24: And let your name be established and be magnified forever, saying, 'Yahweh of hosts, the God of Israel, is Israel's God, and may the house of David your servant be established before you.'
passages.17:25: For you, my God, {have informed}<note: Literally "have opened the ear of"> your servant [that] you will build a house for him. Therefore, your servant has found [courage] to pray before you.
passages.17:26: So now, O Yahweh, you yourself [are] God, and you have spoken to your servant this good thing.
passages.17:27: And now may you begin to bless the house of your servant {to continue forever}<note: Literally "to be forever"> before you, for you, O Yahweh, have blessed. And it will be blessed forever."
passages.18:1: And it happened [that] after David struck the Philistines and subdued them, he captured Gath and its villages out of the hand of the Philistines.
passages.18:2: And he struck Moab, and the Moabites became servants to David, bearing tribute.
passages.18:3: And David struck Hadadezer, king of Zobah-Hamath, as he set up his monument at the Euphrates River.
passages.18:4: And David captured from him one thousand chariots, seven thousand horsemen, and twenty thousand foot soldiers. And David hamstrung all the chariot horses but left one hundred of them [to] remain [for] chariots.
passages.18:5: And when the Arameans of Damascus came to help Hadadezer king of Zobah-Hamath, David struck down twenty-two thousand men of Aram.
passages.18:6: Then David set up [garrisons] in Aram of Damascus, and the Arameans became servants to David, bearing tribute. And Yahweh delivered David wherever he went.
passages.18:7: And David took small round shields of gold that were upon the servants of Hadadezer and brought them [to] Jerusalem.
passages.18:8: And from Tibhath and from Cun, cities of Hadadezer, David captured very much bronze. Solomon made the bronze sea with it along with the columns and objects of bronze.
passages.18:9: And when Tou the king of Hamath heard that David had defeated the whole army of Hadadezer the king of Zobah,
passages.18:10: he sent Hadoram his son to King David to ask him for peace and to bless him because he had fought against Hadadezer and defeated him, for Tou {had been at war}<note: Literally "a man of battles"> with Hadadezer. And [he brought with him] all the objects of gold, silver, and bronze.
passages.18:11: King David dedicated these also to Yahweh, along with the silver and gold that he had taken from all the nations, from Edom, Moab, the sons of Ammon, the Philistines, and Amalek.
passages.18:12: And Abishai son of Zeruiah defeated eighteen thousand of Edom in the Valley of Salt.
passages.18:13: And he put garrisons in Edom, and all Edom became servants to David. And Yahweh delivered David wherever he went.
passages.18:14: So David reigned over all Israel, and {he administered justice}<note: Literally "he was a doer of justice"> and righteousness to all his people.
passages.18:15: And Joab son of Zeruiah [was] over the army, and Jehoshaphat son of Ahilud [was] recorder.
passages.18:16: And Zadok son of Ahitub and Abimelech son of Abiathar [were] priests, and Shavsha [was] secretary.
passages.18:17: And Benaiah son of Jehoiada [was] over the Kerethites and the Pelethites. And the sons of David [were] chief officials under the hand of the king.
passages.19:1: And it happened [that] after this Nahash the king of the {Ammonites}<note: Literally "sons of Ammon"> died, and his son reigned in his place.
passages.19:2: And David said, "I will deal kindly with Hanun the son of Nahash because his father showed kindness to me." So David sent messengers to comfort him concerning his father. And the servants of David came to the land of the {Ammonites},<note: Literally "sons of Ammon"> to Hanun, to comfort him.
passages.19:3: But the princes of the {Ammonites}<note: Literally "sons of Ammon"> said to Hanun, "{Do you think}<note: Literally "In your eyes"> because David sent comforters to you [that] David honors your father? Is it not for the purpose of exploring [so as] to overthrow and spy out the land that his servants have come to you?"
passages.19:4: So Hanun took the servants of David and shaved them and cut off their garments at the middle, up to the buttocks, and sent them away.
passages.19:5: And they went and told David concerning the men, and he inquired of them, for the men were very disgraced. And the king said, "Dwell in Jericho until your beards grow out; then return."
passages.19:6: And when the {Ammonites}<note: Literally "sons of Ammon"> saw that they made themselves odious to David, Hanun and the {Ammonites}<note: Literally "sons of Ammon"> sent one thousand talents of silver to hire for themselves horses and chariots from Aram-Naharaim, Aram-Maacah, and Zobah.
passages.19:7: And they hired for themselves thirty-two thousand chariots and the king of Maacah and his people, and they came and encamped before Medeba. And the {Ammonites}<note: Literally "sons of Ammon"> were gathered from their cities and came to the battle.
passages.19:8: And when David heard, he sent Joab and the entire army of mighty warriors.
passages.19:9: And the {Ammonites}<note: Literally "sons of Ammon"> went out and took up positions for battle at the entrance of the city. And the kings who had come [were] alone in the field.
passages.19:10: When Joab saw that [there was] {a battle line}<note: Literally "the face of the battle"> against him at the front and the back, he chose from among the chosen [men] in Israel and arranged [them] to meet Aram.
passages.19:11: And the remainder of the people he put in the hand of Abishai his brother, and they were arranged to meet the {Ammonites}.<note: Literally "sons of Ammon">
passages.19:12: And he said, "If Aram is too strong for me, then you must be a help to me, but if the {Ammonites}<note: Literally "sons of Ammon"> are too strong for you, then I will help you.
passages.19:13: Be strong! Let us strengthen ourselves on behalf of our people and on behalf of the cities of our God. And may Yahweh do [what is] good in his eyes."
passages.19:14: And Joab and the people who [were] with him drew near before Aram for battle, and they fled before him.
passages.19:15: And when the {Ammonites}<note: Literally "sons of Ammon"> saw that Aram had fled, they also fled before Abishai his brother, and they came to the city. Then Joab came to Jerusalem.
passages.19:16: And when Aram saw that they were defeated before Israel, they sent messengers and brought out Aram, who [was from] beyond the Euphrates,<note: Or "the river"> with Shophach the commander of the army of Hadadezer before them.
passages.19:17: And when it was told to David, he gathered all Israel and crossed the Jordan. And he came to them and was arrayed against them. Then David was arrayed to meet Aram in battle, and they fought with him.
passages.19:18: And Aram fled before Israel. And David killed from Aram [the men of] seven thousand chariots and forty thousand foot soldiers, and he put to death Shophach the commander of the army.
passages.19:19: And when the servants of Hadadezer saw that they were defeated before Israel, they made peace with David and became servants to him. So Aram was no longer willing to help the {Ammonites}.<note: Literally "sons of Ammon">
passages.20:1: And it happened [that] {in the spring time of year},<note: Literally "at the time of the returning of the year"> the time [when] kings go out [to battle], Joab led the troops of the army and destroyed the land of the {Ammonites}.<note: Literally "sons of Ammon"> And he came and besieged Rabbah, but David remained in Jerusalem. And Joab struck Rabbah and destroyed it.
passages.20:2: And David took the crown of their king from his head and found it to weigh a talent of gold. And in it [was] a precious stone. Then it was [placed] upon the head of David. And he brought out the booty of the city, a large amount.
passages.20:3: And the people who [were] in it he brought out, and {he set them to work with saws and iron implements and axes}.<note: The translation comes from 2 Samuel 12:31 since the Hebrew text here is uncertain> Thus David did to all the cities of the {Ammonites}.<note: Literally "sons of Ammon"> Then David returned, and all the nation [went] with him.
passages.20:4: And after this there arose a war in Gezer with the Philistines. Then Sibbecai the Hushathite struck down Sippai, one of the descendants of the Rephaim. And they were subdued.
passages.20:5: And again there was war with the Philistines. And Elhanan son of Jair struck down Lahmi, the brother of Goliath the Gittite, the shaft of whose spear [was] like a weaver's beam.
passages.20:6: And again there was war in Gath. And there was a {very tall}<note: Literally "measured"> man [there], and {he had six fingers on each hand and six toes on each foot, twenty-four in all}.<note: Literally "and his fingers, six and six, twenty-four"> He himself [was] also a descendant of the Rephaim.
passages.20:7: And he taunted Israel, but Jehonathan son of Shimea, brother of David, struck him down.
passages.20:8: These were born to the giants in Gath, and they fell by the hand of David and by the hand of his servants.
passages.21:1: Then Satan<note: Or "[an] accuser," or "[an] adversary"> stood against Israel and urged David to count Israel.
passages.21:2: So David said to Joab and to the commanders of the nation, "Go, count Israel from Beersheba to Dan and bring a report to me that I might know their number."
passages.21:3: But Joab said, "May Yahweh add to the people a hundred times what they are! Are they not, O my lord the king, all of them the king's servants? Why does my lord seek this? Why would he bring guilt to Israel?"
passages.21:4: But the word of the king prevailed over Joab. Then he went about through all Israel and came to Jerusalem.
passages.21:5: And Joab gave the number of the enrollment of the people to David. And it happened [that] all Israel [was] one million one hundred thousand men drawing a sword, and in Judah [were] four hundred and seventy thousand men drawing a sword.
passages.21:6: But he did not count Levi and Benjamin among them, for the word of the king was repulsive to Joab.
passages.21:7: But this word was displeasing in the eyes of God, and he struck Israel.
passages.21:8: Then David said to God, "I have sinned severely [in] that I have done this thing. But now, please forgive the sin of your servant, for I have been very foolish."
passages.21:9: Then Yahweh spoke to Gad the seer of David, saying,
passages.21:10: "Go, you must speak to David, saying, 'Thus says Yahweh: "Three [choices] I offer to you. Choose one of them for yourself that I will do to you." '"
passages.21:11: So Gad came to David and said to him, "Thus says Yahweh: 'Choose for yourself:
passages.21:12: whether three years of famine or three months of devastation by your enemies while the sword of your enemies overtakes you, or three days of the sword of Yahweh, with disease in the land and the angel of Yahweh destroying throughout all the territory in Israel.' So now, see what word I should return to my sender."
passages.21:13: Then David said to Gad, "{I am very troubled}.<note: Literally "Great trouble to me"> Let me into the hand of Yahweh, for his compassion is very great, but do not let me fall into the hand of a man."
passages.21:14: So Yahweh sent a pestilence through Israel, and seventy thousand men from Israel fell.
passages.21:15: And God sent an angel to Jerusalem to destroy it, and as [he was about] to destroy [it], Yahweh saw and was grieved on account of the calamity. Then he said to the angel, the destroyer, "[It is] enough; slacken your hand." And the angel of Yahweh was standing by the threshing floor of Ornan the Jebusite.
passages.21:16: And David lifted his eyes and saw the angel of Yahweh standing between earth and heaven, with his sword drawn in his hand, stretched out over Jerusalem. Then David and the elders, clothed in sackcloth, fell upon their faces.
passages.21:17: Then David said to God, "Was it not I [who] gave a command to count the people? Now I [am] he who has sinned, and I have certainly done wickedness, but these sheep, what have they done? O Yahweh, my God, please let your hand be against me and against the house of my father, but against your people, [let there be] no plague."
passages.21:18: Now the angel of Yahweh had spoken to Gad to say to David that David should go up [and] erect an altar for Yahweh.
passages.21:19: So David went up at the word of Gad that he had spoken in the name of Yahweh.
passages.21:20: Now Ornan was threshing wheat, and Ornan turned and saw the angel, and his four sons with him hid themselves.
passages.21:21: Then David came to Ornan, and Ornan looked and saw David. And he went out from the threshing floor, and they bowed down to David, faces to the ground.
passages.21:22: Then David said to Ornan, "Please give me the place, the threshing floor, that I might build an altar on it to Yahweh; at full price please give it to me, that the plague against the people might be stopped."
passages.21:23: And Ornan said to David, "Take [it] to yourself; let my lord the king do what [is] good in his eyes. See, I give the cattle for the burnt offerings and threshing sledges for the wood and wheat for the grain offering--I give [it] all."
passages.21:24: But King David said to Ornan, "No, for I will certainly buy [it] at full value; indeed, I will not take what is yours for Yahweh and offer burnt offerings for nothing."
passages.21:25: So David gave to Ornan six hundred shekels of gold by weight for the place.
passages.21:26: Then David built an altar there to Yahweh, and he offered burnt offerings and peace offerings, and he called to Yahweh. And he answered him with fire from heaven upon the altar of burnt offering.
passages.21:27: Then Yahweh commanded the angel, and he returned his sword to its sheath.
passages.21:28: At that time, when David saw that Yahweh answered him at the threshing floor of Ornan the Jebusite, he sacrificed there.
passages.21:29: Now the tabernacle of Yahweh that Moses had made in the desert and the altar of burnt offering [were] at that time at the high place of Gibeon.
passages.21:30: But David was not able to go before it to seek God, for he was afraid on account of the sword of the angel of Yahweh.
passages.22:1: Then David said, "This will be the house of Yahweh God, and this altar of burnt offering for Israel."
passages.22:2: And David commanded to assemble the resident aliens who [were] in the land of Israel and appointed stone craftsmen to cut dressed stones to build the house of God.
passages.22:3: And David provided much iron for nails for the doors of the gates and for the seams, and abundant copper [that] could not be weighed,
passages.22:4: and cedar timbers without number, for the Sidonians and Tyrians brought abundant cedars to David.
passages.22:5: Then David said, "Solomon my son [is] a boy and inexperienced, and the house built for Yahweh [must be] exceedingly great in fame and splendor throughout every land. I will make preparations for him." So David provided abundant [materials] before he died.
passages.22:6: Then he called to Solomon his son and commanded him to build a house for Yahweh, the God of Israel.
passages.22:7: And David said to Solomon his son, "I myself had in my heart to build a house for the name of Yahweh my God,
passages.22:8: but it happened [that] the word of Yahweh [came] over me, saying, 'You have shed much blood and have made much war; you shall not build a house for my name because you have shed much blood upon the ground before me.
passages.22:9: Behold, a son shall be born to you; he himself will be a man of rest, and I will give rest to him from all his enemies all around, for his name will be Solomon, and peace and quietness I will give to Israel in his days.
passages.22:10: He himself will build a house for my name, and he himself will be to me a son, and I [will be] to him as a father, and I will establish the throne of his kingdom over Israel forever.'
passages.22:11: Now, my son, Yahweh will be with you, that you may succeed and build the house of Yahweh your God as he has spoken concerning you.
passages.22:12: Only may Yahweh give to you understanding and insight that he might give you charge over Israel and the keeping of the law of Yahweh your God.
passages.22:13: Then you will prosper if you take care to do the statutes and judgments which Yahweh commanded Moses concerning Israel. Be strong and be courageous; fear not and do not be dismayed.
passages.22:14: Now see, with great effort I have made provision for the house of Yahweh: 100,000 talents of gold, 1,000,000 talents of silver, and bronze and iron [that] cannot be weighed, for there is an abundance. Also timber and stone I have provided, but to these you should add.
passages.22:15: And with you [there is] an abundance of craftsmen: stonecutters, masons, carpenters, and everyone skilled in every [kind of] craftsmanship
passages.22:16: with gold, silver, bronze, and iron without number. Arise and work! Yahweh will be with you!"
passages.22:17: And David commanded all the commanders of Israel to help Solomon his son, [saying],
passages.22:18: "Is not Yahweh your God with you? And has he [not] given you rest all around? For he has put in my hand the inhabitants of the land, and the land is subdued before Yahweh and before his people.
passages.22:19: Now set your heart and mind to seek Yahweh your Go, and arise and build the sanctuary of Yahweh God, that the ark of the covenant of Yahweh and the holy vessels of God might be brought into the house built for the name of Yahweh.
passages.23:1: Now David [was] old and full of days. And he made Solomon his son king over Israel.
passages.23:2: And he assembled all the commanders of Israel and the priests and the Levites.
passages.23:3: And the Levites thirty years old and above were counted, and their number according to their head count for the men [was] thirty-eight thousand.
passages.23:4: Of these, [David said,] "Twenty-four thousand [are] to direct the work of the house of Yahweh, along with six thousand judges and officials,
passages.23:5: four thousand gatekeepers, [and] four thousand offering praise with the instruments that I have made for praise."
passages.23:6: And David organized them [in] divisions according to the sons of Levi: to Gershon, Kohath, and Merari.
passages.23:7: For the Gershonites [were] Ladan and Shimei.
passages.23:8: The sons of Ladan: Jehiel the chief and Zetham and Joel, three.
passages.23:9: The sons of Shimei: Shelomoth, Haziel, and Haran, three. These [were] the heads of the {families}<note: Literally "fathers"> of Ladan.
passages.23:10: And the sons of Shimei: Jahath, Zina, Jeush, and Beriah; these four [were] the sons of Shimei.
passages.23:11: And Jahath was the chief, and Zizah the second, but Jeush and Beriah did not have many sons. They were enrolled as one for the house of a father.
passages.23:12: The sons of Kohath: Amram, Izhar, Hebron, and Uzziel, four.
passages.23:13: The sons of Amram: Aaron and Moses. And Aaron was set apart to consecrate the most holy things. He and his sons [were] to burn offerings forever before Yahweh to serve him and to bless in his name forever.
passages.23:14: But Moses the man of God [and] his sons were reckoned among the tribe of Levi.
passages.23:15: The sons of Moses: Gershom and Eliezer.
passages.23:16: The sons of Gershom: Shebuel the chief.
passages.23:17: And the sons of Eliezer were Rehabiah, the head. And Eliezer had no other sons, but the sons of Rehabiah were very many.
passages.23:18: The sons of Izhar: Shelomith the chief.
passages.23:19: The sons of Hebron: Jeriah the chief, Amariah the second, Jahaziel the third, and Jekameam the fourth.
passages.23:20: The sons of Uzziel: Micah the chief and Isshiah the second.
passages.23:21: The sons of Merari: Mahli and Mushi. The sons of Mahli: Eleazar and Kish.
passages.23:22: And Eleazar died, and he did not have sons, but only daughters. And the sons of Kish, their relatives, married them.
passages.23:23: The sons of Mushi: Mahli, Eder, and Jeremoth, three.
passages.23:24: These [were] the sons of Levi according to the house of their fathers, the heads of the {families},<note: Literally "fathers"> according to their enrollment, by the number of the names, according to their head count, [who were to] do the work of the service of the house of Yahweh, from twenty years old and above.
passages.23:25: For David said, "Yahweh, the God of Israel, has given rest to his people, and he dwells in Jerusalem forever.
passages.23:26: And also, the Levites do not [need] to carry the tabernacle and all its vessels for its service."
passages.23:27: For by the last words of David, they [are] the number of the sons of Levi, from twenty years old and above.
passages.23:28: For their station [was] {to assist}<note: Literally "for the hand of"> the sons of Aaron with the service of the house of Yahweh, over the courtyards, over the chambers, and over the cleansing of all the sanctified objects, and [with] the work of the service of the house of God,
passages.23:29: and with the rows of bread, the flour, the grain offering, the wafers of unleavened bread, the baked offering, the offering mixed with oil, and for all the amounts and measurements.
passages.23:30: And [they were] to stand {every morning},<note: Literally "in the morning, in the morning"> thanking and praising Yahweh, and likewise in the evening,
passages.23:31: and for every burnt offering offered to Yahweh, on Sabbaths, on new moon festivals, and at the appointed feasts, according to the customary number {required of them},<note: Literally "over them"> regularly before Yahweh.
passages.23:32: And they shall keep the responsibility of the tent of assembly,<note: Or "meeting"> the responsibility of the sanctified objects, and the responsibility of the sons of Aaron, their brothers, to serve the house of Yahweh.
passages.24:1: And as for the sons of Aaron, [these were] their divisions. The sons of Aaron [were] Nadab and Abihu, Eleazar and Ithamar.
passages.24:2: And Nadab and Abihu died before their father, and {they had no sons},<note: Literally "sons were not to them"> so Eleazar and Ithamar served as priests.
passages.24:3: And David, with Zadok of the sons of Eleazar and Ahimelech of the sons of Ithamar, divided them according to their appointments for their service.
passages.24:4: And more sons of Eleazar were found as heads of the men than the sons of Ithamar, so they divided them to the sons of Eleazar [to be] sixteen heads over the house of the fathers, and to the sons of Ithamar over the house of the fathers [were] eight [heads].
passages.24:5: They divided them by lot {all alike},<note: Literally "these with those"> for they were commanders of the sanctuary and commanders of God from among the sons of Eleazar and the sons of Ithamar.
passages.24:6: And Shemaiah the son of Nethanel, the scribe, from the Levites, recorded them before the king, the princes, Zadok the priest, Ahimelech the son of Abiathar, and the heads of the {families}<note: Literally "fathers"> of the priests and Levites, one father's house drawn by Lot for Eleazar and one drawn by lot for Ithamar.
passages.24:7: And the first lot went out to Jehoiarib, the second to Jedaiah,
passages.24:8: the third to Harim, the fourth to Seorim,
passages.24:9: the fifth to Malkijah, the sixth to Mijamin,
passages.24:10: the seventh to Hakkoz, the eighth to Abijah,
passages.24:11: the ninth to Jeshua, the tenth to Shekaniah,
passages.24:12: the eleventh to Eliashib, the twelfth to Jakim,
passages.24:13: the thirteenth to Huppah, the fourteenth to Jeshebeab,
passages.24:14: the fifteenth to Bilgah, the sixteenth to Immer,
passages.24:15: the seventeenth to Hezir, the eighteenth to Ha-Pizzez,
passages.24:16: the nineteenth to Pethahiah, the twentieth to Ezekiel,
passages.24:17: the twenty-first to Jakin, the twenty-second to Gamul,
passages.24:18: the twenty-third to Delaiah, the twenty-fourth to Maaziah.
passages.24:19: These [were] their appointments for their service to come into the house of Yahweh according to their custom by the hand of Aaron their father, as Yahweh the God of Israel had commanded him.
passages.24:20: And as for the remainder of the sons of Levi: of the sons of Amram, Shubael; of the sons of Shubael, Jehdeiah.
passages.24:21: Of Rehabiah: of the sons of Rehabiah, Isshiah the chief.
passages.24:22: Of the Izharites, Shelomoth; of the sons Shelomoth, Jahath.
passages.24:23: Of the sons of Jeriah, Amariah the second, Jahaziel the third, Jekameam the fourth.
passages.24:24: The sons of Uzziel, Micah; the sons of Micah, Shamur.
passages.24:25: The brother of Micah, Isshiah; of the sons of Isshiah, Zechariah.
passages.24:26: The sons of Merari: Mahli and Mushi; the sons of Jaaziah, his son.<note: Or "Beno">
passages.24:27: The sons of Merari: of Jaaziah, his son,<note: Or "Beno"> Shoham, Zakkur, and Ibri.
passages.24:28: Of Mahli: Eleazar, who had no sons.
passages.24:29: Of Kish: the sons of Kish, Jerahmeel.
passages.24:30: And the sons of Mushi: Mahli, Eder, and Jerimoth. These [were] the sons of the Levites according to the house of their fathers.
passages.24:31: And lots were also cast [for] these, just as their brothers, the sons of Aaron, before David the king, Zadok, Ahimelech, and the heads of the {families}<note: Literally "fathers"> for the priests and for the Levites the fathers, {on the principle of the chief and younger brother alike}.<note: Literally "the head like his brother the younger">
passages.25:1: And David and the commanders of the army set apart for the service the sons of Asaph, [of] Heman, and [of] Jeduthun, who prophesied with stringed instruments, with harps, and with cymbals. And their inventory of the men of the work [and] for their duty was:
passages.25:2: for the sons of Asaph: Zakkur, Joseph, Nethaniah, and Asarelah, sons of Asaph, under the hand<note: That is, under the direction> of Asaph, who prophesied under the hands<note: That is, under the direction> of the king.
passages.25:3: Of Jeduthun, the sons of Jeduthun: Gedaliah, Zeri, Jeshaiah,<note: One Hebrew manuscript and the LXX add "Shimei" between Jeshaiah and Heshabiah (see verse 17)> Heshabiah, and Mattithiah, six, under the hands<note: That is, under the direction> of their father Jeduthun, who prophesied with the stringed instrument with thanksgiving and praise to Yahweh.
passages.25:4: Of Heman, the sons of Heman: Bukkiah, Mattaniah, Uzziel, Shebuel and Jerimoth, Hananiah, Hanani, Eliathah, Giddalti and Romamti-ezer, Joshbekashah, Mallothi, Hothir, Mahazioth.
passages.25:5: All these [were] sons to Heman, the seer of the king, according to the words of God to raise a horn.<note: That is, to exalt Heman> And God had given to Heman fourteen sons and three daughters.
passages.25:6: All these [were] under the {direction}<note: Literally "hands"> of their father in the music of the house of Yahweh, with cymbals, harps, and stringed instruments for the service of the house of God. Asaph, Jeduthun, and Heman [were] under the {direction}<note: Literally "hands"> of the king.
passages.25:7: And their number, along with their brothers, trained singers, all the skilled people for Yahweh, were two hundred and eighty-eight.
passages.25:8: And they cast lots [for] responsibilities {on the principle of small and great alike},<note: Literally "for like the small, like the great"> teacher with student.
passages.25:9: And the first lot for Asaph went out to Joseph; the second to Gedaliahu; he and his brothers and his twelve sons.
passages.25:10: The third, Zakkur, his sons and his brothers, twelve;
passages.25:11: the fourth to Izri, his sons and his brothers, twelve;
passages.25:12: the fifth, Nethaniah, his sons and his brothers, twelve;
passages.25:13: the sixth, Bukkiah, his sons and his brothers, twelve;
passages.25:14: the seventh, Jesarelah, his sons and his brothers, twelve;
passages.25:15: the eighth, Jeshaiah, his sons and his brothers, twelve;
passages.25:16: the ninth, Mattaniah, his sons and his brothers, twelve;
passages.25:17: the tenth, Shimei, his sons and his brothers, twelve;
passages.25:18: eleventh, Azarel, his sons and his brothers, twelve;
passages.25:19: the twelfth to Hashabiah, his sons and his brothers, twelve;
passages.25:20: to [the] thirteenth, Shubael, his sons and his brothers, twelve;
passages.25:21: to [the] fourteenth, Mattithiah, his sons and his brothers, twelve;
passages.25:22: to [the] fifteenth, to Jeremoth, his sons and his brothers, twelve;
passages.25:23: to [the] sixteenth, to Hananiah, his sons and his brothers, twelve;
passages.25:24: to [the] seventeenth, to Joshbekashah, his sons and his brothers, twelve;
passages.25:25: to [the] eighteenth, to Hanani, his sons and his brothers, twelve;
passages.25:26: to [the] nineteenth, to Mallothi, his sons and his brothers, twelve;
passages.25:27: to [the] twentieth, to Eliathah, his sons and his brothers, twelve;
passages.25:28: to [the] twenty-first, to Hothir, his sons and his brothers, twelve;
passages.25:29: to [the] twenty-second, to Giddalti, his sons and his brothers, twelve;
passages.25:30: to [the] twenty-third, to Mahazioth, his sons and his brothers, twelve;
passages.25:31: to [the] twenty-fourth, to Romamti-ezer, his sons and his brothers, twelve.
passages.26:1: As for the working groups of the gatekeepers: of the Korahites, Meshelemiah the son of Kore, from the sons of Asaph.
passages.26:2: And Meshelemiah had sons: Zechariah the firstborn, Jediael the second, Zebadiah the third, Jathniel the fourth,
passages.26:3: Elam the fifth, Jehohana the sixth, Eliehoenai the seventh.
passages.26:4: And Obed-Edom had sons: Shemaiah the firstborn, Jehozabad the second, Joah the third, Sachar the fourth, Nethanel the fifth,
passages.26:5: Ammiel the sixth, Issachar the seventh, Peullethai the eighth; for God blessed him.
passages.26:6: And to Shemaiah his son were sons born who [were] rulers in the house of their father, for they [were] mighty warriors of ability.
passages.26:7: The sons of Shemaiah: Othni, Rephael, Obed, and Elzabad, whose brothers [were] sons of ability, Elihu and Semakiah.
passages.26:8: All these from the sons of Obed-Edom, they and their sons, and their brothers [were] men of ability with strength for service; sixty-two of Obed-Edom.
passages.26:9: And Meshelemiah had sons and brothers, sons of ability, eighteen.
passages.26:10: And Hosah, from the sons of Merari, had sons: Shimri the chief (though he was not firstborn, his father appointed him as chief),
passages.26:11: Hilkiah the second, Tabaliah the third, Zechariah the fourth: all the sons and brothers of Hosah [were] thirteen.
passages.26:12: These working groups of gatekeepers, corresponding to the chief men, had responsibilities like their brothers to serve in the house of Yahweh.
passages.26:13: And they cast lots, small and great alike, by their fathers' houses, {for their gates}.<note: Literally "for gate and gate">
passages.26:14: And the lot fell to the east to Shelemiah. As for Zechariah his son, {a wise counselor},<note: Literally "giving counsel with understanding"> they cast lots. And his lot came out for the north.
passages.26:15: To Obed-Edom [went out] the south, and to his sons, the storehouses.
passages.26:16: For Shuppim and Hosah [it went out] for the west, at the gate of Shalleketh, on the road that goes up, guard for guard.
passages.26:17: To the east, six Levites; to the north, four daily; to the south, four daily; and at the storerooms, two [by] two.
passages.26:18: For the court to the west, four at the road, two at the court.
passages.26:19: These [were] the working groups of the gatekeepers among the sons of the Korahites and among the sons of Merari.
passages.26:20: And of the Levites: Ahijah [was] over the treasuries of the house of God and over the treasuries of the sanctified objects.
passages.26:21: The sons of Ladan: the sons of the Gershonites belonging to Ladan, the heads of the {families}<note: Literally "fathers"> belonging to Ladan the Gershonite: Jehieli.
passages.26:22: The sons of Jehieli, Zetham and Joel his brother, [were] over the treasuries of the house of Yahweh.
passages.26:23: Of the Amramites, the Izharites, the Hebronites, [and] the Ozzielites:
passages.26:24: Shebuel the son of Gershom, the son of Moses, [was] commander over the treasuries.
passages.26:25: And his brothers: from Eliezer [were] Rehabiah his son, and Jeshaiah his son, and Joram his son, and Zikri his son, and Shelomoth his son.
passages.26:26: That Shelomoth and his brothers [were] over all the treasuries of the sanctified objects that King David and the heads of the {families}<note: Literally "fathers"> to the commanders of thousands and hundreds and the commanders of the army had dedicated.
passages.26:27: From the battles and from the spoil they had dedicated [these things] to strengthen the house of Yahweh.
passages.26:28: And all that Samuel the seer, and Saul the son of Kish, and Abner the son of Ner, and Joab the son of Zeruiah had dedicated--all the dedicated gifts [were] under the hand of Shelomith and his brothers.
passages.26:29: For the Izharites: Kenaniah and his sons [were appointed] to the duties outside of Israel as officials and as judges.
passages.26:30: For the Hebronites: Hashabiah and his brothers, one thousand seven hundred men of ability, [were] over the administration of Israel beyond the Jordan westward, for all the work of Yahweh and for the service of the king.
passages.26:31: For the Hebronites: Jeriah the chief of the Hebronites for the genealogy for the {families}.<note: Literally "fathers"> (In the fortieth year of the reign of David they were examined, and there was found among them mighty warriors of strength at Jazer in Gilead.)
passages.26:32: And his brothers, sons of ability, [were] two thousand seven hundred heads of the {families},<note: Literally "fathers"> and King David appointed them over the Reubenites, the Gadites, and the half-tribe of Manasseh, for every matter of God and matter of the king.
passages.27:1: And as for the number of the {Israelites},<note: Literally "sons/children of Israel"> the heads of {families},<note: Literally "fathers"> the commanders of thousands and hundreds, and their officials who serve the king in all matters of the working groups that came and went, month by month, throughout all the months of the year, each working group: twenty-four thousand.
passages.27:2: Over the first working group for the first month: Jashobeam the son of Zabdiel. And [he was] over his working group [of] twenty-four thousand.
passages.27:3: From the sons of Perez [who was] the chief of the commanders of the armies for the first month.
passages.27:4: And over the working groups of the second month: Dodai the Ahohite and his working group, and Mikloth the commander. And [he was] over his working group [of] twenty-four thousand.
passages.27:5: The third commander of the army for the third month [was] Benaiah son of Jehoiada the chief priest. And [he was] over his working group [of] twenty-four thousand.
passages.27:6: This [was] Benaiah [who was] a mighty warrior of thirty, and over the thirty and his working group [was] Ammizabad his son.
passages.27:7: The fourth, for the fourth month, [was] Asahel the brother of Joab and his son Zebadiah after him. And [he was] over his working group [of] twenty-four thousand.
passages.27:8: The fifth, for the fifth month, the commander [was] Shamhuth the Izrahite. And [he was] over his working group [of] twenty-four thousand.
passages.27:9: The sixth, for the sixth month, [was] Ira the son of Ikkesh the Tekoite. And [he was] over his working group [of] twenty-four thousand.
passages.27:10: The seventh, for the seventh month, [was] Helez the Pelonite, from the sons of Ephraim. And [he was] over his working group [of] twenty-four thousand.
passages.27:11: The eighth, for the eighth month, [was] Sibbecai the Hushathite of the Zerahites. And [he was] over his working group [of] twenty-four thousand.
passages.27:12: The ninth, for the ninth month, [was] Abiezer the Anathothite of the Benjamites. And [he was] over his working group [of] twenty-four thousand.
passages.27:13: The tenth, for the tenth month, [was] Maharai the Netophathite of the Zerahites. And [he was] over his working group [of] twenty-four thousand.
passages.27:14: The eleventh, for the eleventh month, [was] Benaiah the Pirathonite from the sons of Ephraim. And [he was] over his working group [of] twenty-four thousand.
passages.27:15: The twelfth, for the twelfth month, [was] Heldai the Netophathite, of Othniel. And [he was] over his working group [of] twenty-four thousand.
passages.27:16: And over the tribes of Israel, for the Reubenites: the commander [was] Eliezer the son of Zikri. For the Simeonites: Shephatiah the son of Maacah.
passages.27:17: For Levi: Hashabiah the son of Kemuel. For Aaron, Zadok.
passages.27:18: For Judah: Elihu, from the brothers of David. For Issachar: Omri the son of Michael.
passages.27:19: For Zebulun: Ishmaiah the son of Obadiah. For Naphtali: Jerimoth the son of Azriel.
passages.27:20: For the Ephraimites: Hoshea the son of Azaziah. For the half-tribe of Manasseh: Joel the son of Pedaiah.
passages.27:21: For the half-tribe of Manasseh in Gilead: Iddo the son of Zechariah. For Benjamin: Jaasiel son of Abner.
passages.27:22: For Dan: Azarel the son of Jeroham. These [were] the commanders of the tribes of Israel.
passages.27:23: And David did not {take a census of those twenty years old or under}<note: Literally "take up their count from a son of twenty years and to less"> because Yahweh promised<note: Or "said"> to make Israel more numerous than the stars of heaven.
passages.27:24: Joab the son of Zeruiah began to count, but he did not finish. But wrath came upon Israel concerning this, and the number was not included in {the chronicles}<note: Literally "in the numbering of the words of the days"> of King David.
passages.27:25: And over the treasury rooms of the king [was] Azmaveth the son of Adiel. And over the treasuries in the country, in the cities, in the unwalled villages, and in the towers [was] Jonathan the son of Uzziah.
passages.27:26: And over those who did the work in the field to till the soil [was] Ezri the son of Kelub.
passages.27:27: And over the vineyards [was] Shemei the Ramathite. And over the produce in the vineyards for the storehouses of the wine [was] Zabdi the Shiphmite.
passages.27:28: And over the olive trees and the sycamore trees that [were] in the Shephelah [was] Baal-Hanan the Gederite. And over the treasury houses of olive oil [was] Joash.
passages.27:29: And over the cattle pastured in the Sharon [was] Shitrai the Sharonite. And over the cattle in the valley [was] Shaphat the son of Adlai.
passages.27:30: And over the camels [was] Obil the Ishmaelite. And over the female donkeys [was] Jehdeiah the Meronothite.<note: 1 Chronicles 27:31 begins here in the Hebrew Bible> And over the sheep [was] Jaziz the Hagrite.
passages.27:31: All of these [were] officials of the property of King David.
passages.27:32: And Jehonathan the uncle of David [was] an adviser, a man of insight, and he was a scribe. And Jehiel the son of Hachmoni [was] with the sons of the king.
passages.27:33: And Ahithophel [was] an adviser to the king, and Hushai the Arkite [was] a friend of the king.
passages.27:34: And after Ahithophel [came] Jehoiada, the son of Benaiah, and Abiathar. And Joab [was] the commander of the king's army.
passages.28:1: Then David assembled all the commanders of Israel, the commanders of the tribes and the commanders of working groups who served the king, and the commanders of thousands, the commanders of hundreds, and the commanders over all the property of the king and his sons, with the court officials and mighty warriors, and all the mighty warriors of ability, at Jerusalem.
passages.28:2: And King David rose to his feet and said, "Listen to me, my brothers and my people. {I myself wanted}<note: Literally "I myself with my heart"> to build a house of rest for the ark of the covenant of Yahweh and the footstool of our God, and I prepared to build.
passages.28:3: But God said to me, 'You may not build a house for my name because you [are] a man of war, and you have shed blood.'
passages.28:4: But Yahweh the God of Israel chose me from all of the house of my father to be king over Israel forever, for he chose Judah as leader, and in the house of Judah, the house of my father, and among the sons of my father he took pleasure in me to reign over all Israel.
passages.28:5: And from all my sons--for Yahweh has given many sons to me--he has chosen Solomon my son to sit on the throne of the kingdom of Yahweh over Israel.
passages.28:6: And he said to me, 'Solomon your son, he himself shall build my house and my courts, for I have chosen him as a son to myself, and I myself will be as a father to him,
passages.28:7: and I will establish his kingdom forever if {he firmly performs}<note: Literally "if he is strong to do"> my commandments and my judgments as [he has to] this day.'
passages.28:8: So now in the sight of all Israel, the assembly of Yahweh, and in the hearing of our God, observe and seek all the commandments of Yahweh your God so that you may take possession of this good land and bestow [it] as an inheritance to your children after you forever."
passages.28:9: "And you, Solomon my son, know the God of your father and serve him with a whole heart and a willing mind, for Yahweh searches all hearts and understands every plan and [all] thoughts. If you seek him, he will be found by you, but if you abandon him, he will reject you forever.
passages.28:10: Look now, for Yahweh has chosen you to build a house for the sanctuary; be strong and do it!"
passages.28:11: Then David gave to Solomon his son the plan of the vestibule and of its houses, its treasuries, its upper rooms, its inner chambers, and of the house of the lid of the ark,
passages.28:12: and the plan of all {that he had in mind}<note: Literally "that was in the spirit with him"> for the courtyards of the house of Yahweh and for all the surrounding storage rooms, the treasuries of the house of God, and the treasuries for sanctified objects,
passages.28:13: and for the working groups of the priests and the Levites, and for all the work of the service of the house of Yahweh, and for all the vessels for the service of the house of Yahweh,
passages.28:14: [and] for the gold, according to the weight of the gold for all the vessels of the service, and the service of all the vessels of silver according to the weight of all the vessels {for every kind of service}.<note: Literally "service and service">
passages.28:15: And the weight of the golden lampstands and the golden lamps, {the weight of each lampstand and each lamp},<note: Literally "by weight of lampstand and lampstand, with its lamp and to the lamps"> [and] the silver according to the weight of a lampstand and its lamp, according to the use of {each lampstand},<note: Literally "lampstand and lampstand">
passages.28:16: and the weight of gold for the tables of the arranged [bread], {each table},<note: Literally "to table and table"> and silver for the tables of silver,
passages.28:17: and pure gold [for] the three-pronged meat forks, and the bowls and the pitchers, and for the golden bowls, by weight for {each bowl},<note: Literally "for bowl and bowl"> and for the silver bowls, by weight for {each bowl},<note: Literally "for bowl and bowl">
passages.28:18: and for the altar of incense [made of] refined gold, by weight, and gold for the plan for the chariot--the cherubim with outspread and covering wings over the ark of the covenant of Yahweh.
passages.28:19: "All this [I give you] in writing; from the hand of Yahweh he instructed me [about] all the workings of this plan."
passages.28:20: Then David said to Solomon his son, "Be strong and courageous, and do [this]! Do not be afraid and do not be dismayed, for Yahweh God, my God, [is] with you. He will not fail you and will not forsake you until all the work of the service of the house of Yahweh is finished.
passages.28:21: And behold, the working groups of the priests and the Levites for all the service of the house of God; and with you in all the work for all [those] willing with the skill for every service, and the commanders and all the people for all your commands."
passages.29:1: Then David the king said to all the assembly, "God has chosen Solomon my son alone, a young man and inexperienced, and the work [is] great, for the citadel [is] not for humankind, but for Yahweh God.
passages.29:2: So I have provided for the house of my God according to all my strength, the gold for the things of gold, the silver for the things of silver, the bronze for the things of bronze, the iron for the things of iron, and the wood for the things of wood, [along with] an abundance of onyx stones, stones for settings, stones of turquoise, and variegated stones, and all [kinds of] precious stones and alabaster stones.
passages.29:3: And moreover, with respect to my provisions for the house of my God I have a treasure of gold and silver that I have given to the house of my God above all that I have provided for the holy house:
passages.29:4: three thousand talents of gold from the gold of Ophir and seven thousand talents of refined silver to overlay the walls of the houses,
passages.29:5: gold for the golden things and silver for the silver things, for all the work by the hand of skilled craftsmen. Now who will offer willingly, {consecrating himself}<note: Literally "to consecrate his hand"> today to Yahweh?"
passages.29:6: Then the commanders of the {families},<note: Literally "fathers"> the commanders of the tribes of Israel, and the commanders of thousands and hundreds, and the commanders of the work of the king offered themselves willingly.
passages.29:7: And they gave for the service of the house of God five thousand talents and ten thousand darics of gold, ten thousand talents of silver, eighteen thousand talents of bronze, and one hundred thousand talents of iron.
passages.29:8: And whoever had [precious] stones gave [them] to the treasury of the house of Yahweh under the authority<note: Or "hand"> of Jehiel the Gershonite.
passages.29:9: And the people rejoiced over their freewill offering, for with a whole heart they had willingly offered to Yahweh, and King David also rejoiced with great joy.
passages.29:10: Then David blessed Yahweh in the sight of all the assembly, and David said, "Blessed [are] you, O Yahweh, God of Israel, our father forever and ever!
passages.29:11: To you, O Yahweh, [is] the greatness and the power and the splendor and the glory and the strength, for everything in the heavens and in the earth. Yours, O Yahweh, [is] the kingdom and exaltation over all as head!
passages.29:12: And wealth and glory [are] from you, and you rule over all. And in your hand [is] power and might. And in your hand [is power] to make great and to give strength to all.
passages.29:13: And now, our God, we give thanks to you and offer praise to the name of your splendor.
passages.29:14: And indeed, who [am] I, and who [are] my people that we retain power to offer according to these [offerings] willingly? For everything [is] from you, and from your hand we have given to you.
passages.29:15: For we [are] strangers before you and sojourners like all our ancestors.<note: Or "fathers"> Our days [are] like the shadow upon earth, and there is no hope [of abiding].
passages.29:16: O Yahweh our God, all this abundance that we have provided to build for you a house for your holy name is from your hand, and all [of it] is yours.
passages.29:17: And I know, my God, that you yourself test the heart and are pleased with uprightness. I, in the uprightness of my heart, have willingly offered all these [things], and now I have seen your people who are found here willingly offer to you.
passages.29:18: O Yahweh, God of Abraham, Isaac, and Israel, our ancestors,<note: Or "fathers"> keep this forever as a plan [and] thoughts of the heart of your people, and establish their heart toward you.
passages.29:19: Grant to Solomon my son a heart of peace to keep your commands, your statutes, and your regulations to do everything, and to build the citadel for which I have provided."
passages.29:20: And David said to all the assembly, "Bless Yahweh your God!" And all the assembly blessed Yahweh, the God of their ancestors.<note: Or "fathers"> And they bowed down and prostrated themselves before Yahweh and the king.
passages.29:21: And they offered sacrifices to Yahweh, and on that next day they offered burnt offerings to Yahweh: one thousand bulls, one thousand rams, one thousand lambs, with their libations and sacrifices in abundance for all Israel.
passages.29:22: And they ate and drank before Yahweh on that day with great joy. And they made Solomon the son of David king the second time, and they anointed [him] commander for Yahweh, and Zadok the priest.
passages.29:23: Then Solomon sat upon the throne of Yahweh as king in place of David his father. And he prospered, and all Israel obeyed him.
passages.29:24: And all the officials and mighty warriors, and also all the sons of King David, {pledged allegiance to}<note: Literally "placed a hand under"> King Solomon.
passages.29:25: And Yahweh made Solomon exceedingly great in the sight of all Israel, and he bestowed upon him royal splendor that was not [bestowed] upon any king before him in Israel.
passages.29:26: And David the son of Jesse reigned over all Israel.
passages.29:27: And the days that he reigned over Israel [were] forty years. In Hebron he reigned seven years, and in Jerusalem he reigned thirty-three years.
passages.29:28: And he died in a good old age, full of days, wealth, and honor. And Solomon his son reigned in his place.
passages.29:29: Now the words of King David, [from] the first to the last, see, they are written among the words of Samuel the seer, and among the words of Nathan the prophet, and among the words of Gad the seer,
passages.29:30: with all [the accounts of] his kingdom, his power, and the times that came upon him, and upon Israel, and upon all the kingdoms of the earth.
